definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: Are we so uninformed about issues that we can be bought so easily?
sentences.chinese: 我们真的这么愚昧无知到不知道自己可以被轻易收买？

sentences.english: You can certainly gain popularity; however, don't do it by paying for everyone else.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问能够获得声望，但是，不要靠收买人心得来。

sentences.english: He seems to think he can buy me over very cheaply.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎以为他能轻易收买我。

sentences.english: The corrupt official bought off those who might expose him.
sentences.chinese: 那名接受贿赂的官员收买了那些可能会揭发他的人。

sentences.english: Rumours of a shortage stampeded people into buying up food.
sentences.chinese: 他们经常收买一定数量的工会领导人。

sentences.english: He has loyal, and well paid, military officials to perform the role of figurehead.
sentences.chinese: 他自有受到他丰厚收买的忠实军事领导当他的傀儡。

sentences.english: For buying, leverage proven interviewing techniques.
sentences.chinese: 利用经过验证的面试技巧“收买人心”。
该候选人收买了投票人。

sentences.english: The prisoners escaped after getting to  the guards to leave the gate open.
sentences.chinese: 囚犯们收买了看守人员，让他们把大门打开后逃跑了。

sentences.english: ChengJun hospitality will hold a press announced the buy benevolence, the attempt to establish really.
sentences.chinese: 成俊召开记者款待会，宣布了收买仁真建立的企图。

sentences.english: They suborn witnesses to testify that he has spoken against Moses and the Temple.
sentences.chinese: 他们收买证人作证说，他已表示反对摩西和圣殿。

sentences.english: Toodle was evidently not to be bought over.
sentences.chinese: 图德尔显然是收买不了的。

sentences.english: The president tried to suborn false witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 总统试图收买虚假证人。

sentences.english: He was charged with conspiracy to suborn witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 他被指控阴谋收买证人作伪证。

sentences.english: And second of all, he believes he can buy off parliament.
sentences.chinese: 其次，尤素福认为他可以收买议会。

sentences.english: The USis trying to buy friends with ideas and security.
sentences.chinese: 美国试图用创意和安全来收买朋友。

definition: to instigate (rebellion etc)/incitement (e.g. to desertion within opposing camp)
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to offer for sale/to sell/to sell out or betray
to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
to place in a certain position/to assign to a job/to plant/resettlement (old)
to drive a wedge between (allies, partners etc)
to coerce (sb into doing sth bad)/to lure (into a trap)/to seduce
to rely on help from sb
